I recently had to go through the struggle of getting neat to compile correc=
tly 
myself.  With modern versions of the libraries and gcc, there are a nu=
mber of 
build problems you run into. There are two big things that I can p=
oint to as 
a start.  First is that you must have version 1 of gtkmm.  You =
have 2.4.  
Also, you should go through and change the headers to the newer=
 format.  For 
example, everywhere that you see 
	#include <iostream.h>
you=
 want to change that to simply be 
	#include <iostream> 

From there, make =
the appropriate changes, fixing errors as they show up in the 
compilation.=
  If you are not comfortable working in c++, it is difficult 
undertaking. =
 Since I did not particularly like having multiple versions of 
gtkmm on my=
 machine, and never was comfortable with swig and guile, I just 
decided to=
 redo the visuals and front end in QT.  Still not quite done with 
that.  R=
eworking from scratch seems to be cleaner and easier than just 
debugging t=
he compilation however.  Your milage may vary however.

Another alternative=
 may just be to install an older version of Debian.  You 
could also use on=
e of the other implementations available to play with.  

-- 

Mark Ahlstro=
